headline.main: DROP IN EXPORTS IS SPREAD WIDELY; $295,000,000 Total Last Month Was Off From $350,000,000 in the Previous Period

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31--A breakdown of foreign trade by countries in September, issued today by the Department of Commerce, indicates that the sharp decline in United States exports from $350,000,000 in August to $295,000,000 was the result of reduced shipments not only to British countries but also to Latin America, Japan, the Soviet Union and other areas.
